meico.app.gui

Class DataObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.Group
          • meico.app.gui.DataObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    class DataObject
extends javafx.scene.Group
    This class represents the data objects and provides graphical interface elements for it. To add new items/functionality in a radial menu, add its label text to the corresponding array in makeRadialMenu() and add its functionality to setMenuItemInteraction().
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      returns true as long as it is activated
      protected DataObject makeChild(java.lang.Object object, javafx.geometry.Point2D at)
      this creates an instance of DataObject from the specified object, draws it at the specified position in the workspace, draws a connecting line between this and the new object, and puts the line in both's list of lines

      create the radial menu around the center circle

      a generic method to define the interaction of a menu item; what the item actually does must be provided via parameter inter
      protected java.lang.Object readFile(java.io.File file)
      given an input file, from its extension this method decides which type of object to instantiate and returns the result or null if unknown
      java.lang.Object readXmlFileToCorrectType(java.io.File file)
      When an XML file is loaded it has to be identified as MEI, MSM, MusicXML etc. to create the right instance.

      define the interactivity

      a convenience method for placing the graphical representation of this
      private void setMenuItemInteraction(javafx.scene.Group item, javafx.scene.text.Text label, javafx.scene.shape.Path body)

      start a thread and add its reference to the threads list (for maintenance purposes)
